alert.note: Alert for City of Hopewell; City of Petersburg; Prince George (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 23 at 5:51PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Virginia, including the following county and independent cities, City of Hopewell, City of Petersburg and Prince George. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 551 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Petersburg, Hopewell, Colonial Heights, Fort Gregg-Adams, Prince George, Petersburg National Battlefield, Birchett Estate and Jordan Point Country Club. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: City of Hopewell; City of Petersburg; Prince George
